com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.wrappers

Enum HumanHand

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<HumanHand>
      • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.wrappers.HumanHand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<HumanHand>

    public enum HumanHand
extends java.lang.Enum<HumanHand>
    HumanHand is a mirror of Bukkit's MainHand. It is here for backwards compatibility with MC 1.8.8.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      LEFT 
      RIGHT 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static HumanHand fromMainHand(java.lang.Object mainHand)
      Converts Bukkit's MainHand property to the HumanHand LEFT/RIGHT constants.
      static HumanHand fromNMSEnumHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity, java.lang.Object nmsEnumHand)
      Converts a net.minecraft.server.EnumHand into a HumanHand, keeping in mind whether LEFT/RIGHT is the MAIN or OFF hand.
      static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getHeldItem(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity, HumanHand humanHand)
      Gets the item held in a given hand for a human entity.

      On versions before and including MC 1.8.8 this method always returns null for the LEFT hand, and will return the held item for the RIGHT hand.
      static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getItemInMainHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity)
      Gets the item held in the main hand of the human
      static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getItemInOffHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity)
      Gets the item held in the off hand of the human.
      static HumanHand getMainHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity)
      Gets the main hand in use by a human.
      static HumanHand getOffHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity)
      Gets the off hand in use by a human.
      HumanHand opposite()
      Gets the opposite hand (LEFT -> RIGHT, RIGHT->LEFT)
      static void setHeldItem(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity, HumanHand humanHand, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      Sets the item held in a given hand for a human entity.

      On versions before and including MC 1.8.8 this method silently fails for the LEFT hand, and will instead set the held item only for the RIGHT hand.
      static void setItemInMainHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      Sets the item held in the main hand of the human.
      static void setItemInOffHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      Sets the item held in the off hand of the human.

      Converts a HumanHand into a net.minecraft.server.EnumHand, keeping in mind whether LEFT/RIGHT is the MAIN or OFF hand.

      • values

        public static HumanHand[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (HumanHand c : HumanHand.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static HumanHand valueOf(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:

      • opposite

        public final HumanHand opposite()
        Gets the opposite hand (LEFT -> RIGHT, RIGHT->LEFT)
        Returns:
        opposite hand

      • toMainHand

        public java.lang.Object toMainHand()
        Converts this HumanHand to Bukkit's MainHand. This method always returns null on versions before and including 1.8.8.
        Parameters:
        hand - to convert
        Returns:
        MainHand

      • toNMSEnumHand

        public java.lang.Object toNMSEnumHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity)
        Converts this HumanHand into a net.minecraft.server.EnumHand, keeping in mind whether LEFT/RIGHT is the MAIN or OFF hand. When null is used for humanEntity it is assumed the player's main hand is RIGHT.

        On versions before and including MC 1.8.8 this method always returns null.
        Parameters:
        humanEntity - to query for main hand information
        humanHand - to convert
        Returns:
        net.minecraft.server.EnumHand

      • fromMainHand

        public static HumanHand fromMainHand(java.lang.Object mainHand)
        Converts Bukkit's MainHand property to the HumanHand LEFT/RIGHT constants. This wrapper is required for backwards compatibility with MC 1.8.8. On versions before and including MC 1.8.8 this method always returns RIGHT.
        Parameters:
        human - the main hand is for
        mainHand - of the human (MainHand)
        Returns:
        HumanHand

      • getMainHand

        public static HumanHand getMainHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity)
        Gets the main hand in use by a human. This will always return RIGHT on versions before and including MC 1.8.8. When null is used for the humanEntity parameter, this method will always return RIGHT as well.
        Parameters:
        humanEntity - to get the main hand for
        Returns:
        main human hand

      • getOffHand

        public static HumanHand getOffHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity)
        Gets the off hand in use by a human. This will always return LEFT on versions before and including MC 1.8.8. When null is used for the humanEntity parameter, this method will always return LEFT as well.
        Parameters:
        humanEntity - to get the off hand for
        Returns:
        off human hand

      • toMainHand

        public static java.lang.Object toMainHand(HumanHand hand)
        Converts a HumanHand to Bukkit's MainHand. This method always returns null on versions before and including MC 1.8.8.
        Parameters:
        hand - to convert
        Returns:
        MainHand

      • fromNMSEnumHand

        public static HumanHand fromNMSEnumHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity,
                                        java.lang.Object nmsEnumHand)
        Converts a net.minecraft.server.EnumHand into a HumanHand, keeping in mind whether LEFT/RIGHT is the MAIN or OFF hand. When null is used for humanEntity it is assumed the player's main hand is RIGHT.

        On versions before and including MC 1.8.8 this method always returns null.
        Parameters:
        humanEntity - to query for main hand information
        nmsEnumHand - to convert into a HumanHand
        Returns:
        HumanHand

      • toNMSEnumHand

        public static java.lang.Object toNMSEnumHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity,
                                             HumanHand humanHand)
        Converts a HumanHand into a net.minecraft.server.EnumHand, keeping in mind whether LEFT/RIGHT is the MAIN or OFF hand. When null is used for humanEntity it is assumed the player's main hand is RIGHT.

        On versions before and including MC 1.8.8 this method always returns null.
        Parameters:
        humanEntity - to query for main hand information
        humanHand - to convert
        Returns:
        net.minecraft.server.EnumHand

      • getHeldItem

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getHeldItem(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity,
                                                         HumanHand humanHand)
        Gets the item held in a given hand for a human entity.

        On versions before and including MC 1.8.8 this method always returns null for the LEFT hand, and will return the held item for the RIGHT hand.
        Parameters:
        humanEntity - to query the held item
        humanHand - where the item is to be found
        Returns:
        held item

      • setHeldItem

        public static void setHeldItem(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity,
                               HumanHand humanHand,
                               org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Sets the item held in a given hand for a human entity.

        On versions before and including MC 1.8.8 this method silently fails for the LEFT hand, and will instead set the held item only for the RIGHT hand.
        Parameters:
        humanEntity - to set the held item for
        humanHand - where the held item must be changed
        item - to set for the hand

      • getItemInMainHand

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getItemInMainHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity)
        Gets the item held in the main hand of the human
        Parameters:
        humanEntity - to get the main hand held item
        Returns:
        held item

      • getItemInOffHand

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getItemInOffHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity)
        Gets the item held in the off hand of the human. This method will always return null on versions before and including MC 1.8.8.
        Parameters:
        humanEntity - to get the off hand held item
        Returns:
        held item

      • setItemInMainHand

        public static void setItemInMainHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity,
                                     org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Sets the item held in the main hand of the human.
        Parameters:
        humanEntity - to set the main hand held item
        item - to set to

      • setItemInOffHand

        public static void setItemInOffHand(org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity humanEntity,
                                    org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Sets the item held in the off hand of the human. This method will silently fail on versions before and including MC 1.8.8.
        Parameters:
        humanEntity - to set the off hand held item
        item - to set to
